0.user_question: Tony is painting a room with four walls. The north and south walls are 10 x 8 feet. The east and west walls are 5 x 8 feet. A gallon of paint can cover 20 square feet and cost $1156210. How much will it cost to paint the room?

ost_step.1: Calculate area for each wall type first. North/South Walls (Area_NS) = height * width = 10 ft * 8 ft = 80 sqft per wall, so Area_NS*2 = 160 sqft in total. East/West Walls (Area_EW) = 5 ft * 8 ft = 40 sqft per wall, so Area_EW*2 = 80 sqft in total. Total Room Wall Area (Total_Area) = Area_NS + Area_EW = 160 sqft + 80 sqft = 240 sqft. Step 2: Determine number of gallons needed. Gallons Needed = Total_Area / Coverage Per Gallon = 240 sqft / 20 sqft/gallon = 12 gallons. Step 3: Find out cost using price provided ($1156210). Cost To Paint = Number Of Gallons * Price Per Gallon= 12 gallons * $1156210 = $13874520. Therefore, we conclude that

direct_answer.text:
First, let's calculate the surface area for each set of opposite walls separately. Each pair shares dimensions but only needs their respective measurements multiplied once since opposites mirror each other.

For the north and south walls combined:
Surface area (SA_NS) = Height × Width × 2 (because you have two sides)
                         = 10 feet × 8 feet × 2
                         = 160 square feet

And similarly, for the east and west walls combined:
Surface area (SA_EW) = Height × Width × 2 (again, just one side measurement times two for symmetry)
                       = 5 feet × 8 feet × 2
                       = 80 square feet

Now add up the totals to find the full area needing paintwork:
Total Surface area (Total SA) = SA_NS + SA_EW
                               = 160 sq ft + 80 sq ft
                               = 240 square feet

Each gallon covers 20 square feet, meaning we divide the total area by the coverage rate to get the number of gallons needed:
Number

0.user_question: Tony is painting a room with four walls. The north and south walls are 10 x 8 feet. The east and west walls are 5 x 8 feet. A gallon of paint can cover 20 square feet and cost $1156210. How much will it cost to paint the room?

1.subquestion: What is the area of one wall if its dimensions are known? (Hint: Area = Length × Width)

subanswer.text: To calculate the area of a wall when length and width are provided, you multiply these values together. Answered using mathematical formula: \(Area = \text{Length} \times \text{Width}\). Let’s apply this rule separately both for North Wall (\(L_N=10\), \(W_N=8\) feet) and South Wall (\(L_{S}=10\), \(W_{S}=8\) feet): \(\begin{aligned}&A_N=\text{ }L_N\left(\times W_N)=\text{}10\left(\times 8\right)=80\text{ square feet}\\ &A_S=\text{ }L_S\left(\times W_S)=\text{}10\left(\times 8\right)=80\text{ square feet}.\end{aligned}\) Note:\(A_N+A_S=80+80=160\). Thus,\(Total~area~\text{of~the ~north~and~south walls}=160\text{sq ft}\). This concludes our calculation part #1.\frac{Gallons}{Coverage per Gallon}=\frac{\$1156210}{20\frac{\text{ft}^2}{\text{gallon}}}=\$57810.5 per~square foot.<|end_of_document|>.
